record.dc:title: Fe-V redox flow batteries
record.dc:creator: Li, Liyu; Kim, Soowhan; Yang, Zhenguo; Wang, Wei; Zhang, Jianlu; Chen, Baowei; Nie, Zimin; Xia, Guanguang
record.dc:description: A redox flow battery having a supporting solution that includes Cl.sup.- anions is characterized by an anolyte having V.sup.2+ and V.sup.3+ in the supporting solution, a catholyte having Fe.sup.2+ and Fe.sup.3+ in the supporting solution, and a membrane separating the anolyte and the catholyte. The anolyte and catholyte can have V cations and Fe cations, respectively, or the anolyte and catholyte can each contain both V and Fe cations in a mixture. Furthermore, the supporting solution can contain a mixture of SO.sub.4.sup.2- and Cl.sup.- anions.
record.dcq:publisherResearch: PNNL (Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL), Richland, WA (United States))
record.dc:identifier: OSTI ID: 1140135, Legacy ID: OSTI ID: 1140135
record.dc:rights: Patent Assignee: Battelle Memorial Institute (Richland, WA)
